medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute epigastric pain radiating to the back
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced a relatively sudden onset of mid-epigastric pain one day prior to presentation, which progressed throughout the afternoon. The pain was associated with mild pleurisy and was worse with movement. It did not improve with Tums.
medical_history.family_history: Alcohol dependence and CAD in family
medical_history.social_history: Increased alcohol intake (beers) over the past few weeks
